intro: Adonis coriacea, commonly known as the rough adonis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Caucasus. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of bright yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Adonis coriacea is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
